videos.title: Oddworld x Souly - wzf / maybach (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "WZF / Maybach" by Oddworld x Souly is a visually striking and dynamic production. The video features high-energy performances and a mix of urban and futuristic aesthetics. With vibrant colors and fast-paced edits, the visual storytelling complements the rhythm and intensity of the track. The artists are showcased in various locations, including industrial backdrops and sleek, modern settings, adding to the video's edgy and stylish vibe. The direction creatively blends elements of hip-hop culture with innovative visual effects, making it a captivating watch from start to finish.

It also highlights the launch of a special edition Seamaster watch, designed to commemorate the upcoming Olympics.

videos.title: Sam Akpro - Death By Entertainment (2023)
videos.description: The music video for "Death By Entertainment" by Sam Akpro, directed by Pedro Takahashi, presents the artist and his band as Wall Street-style bankers caught in an endless loop of hard work and intense leisure. The video employs split screens and dynamic camera movements to convey a melancholic yet captivating atmosphere, mirroring the song's themes of repetitive daily life and the blurring lines between day and night due to physical and mental exhaustion.

videos.title: 21 Savage - redrum (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.

videos.description: In Sabrina Carpenter's music video for "Taste," co-starring Jenna Ortega, the duo engage in a gory, darkly comedic rivalry over a two-timing boyfriend. Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.

The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.

Directed by Dave Meyers, the video features numerous campy horror and cult film references, including scenes inspired by Death Becomes Her and Kill Bill. Carpenter and Ortega repeatedly murder each other in elaborate ways, including stabbings, voodoo dolls, and falls from great heights, only to make up with a kiss. In collaboration with Jacobi Mehringer, Anna Arnell, and Lizzy Walker.

videos.title: 21 Savage - redrum (2024)
videos.description: The music video for "Redrum" by 21 Savage, featured on his album "American Dream," is directed by Danny Seth and showcases a return to the artist's roots in London. It contrasts iconic landmarks with the grittier areas of Brixton, symbolizing the song's themes. The track itself, produced by London on da Track, samples "Serenata do Adeus" and incorporates elements from "The Shining," including the famous line "Here's Johnny!" Despite some opinions that the video could have more directly referenced "The Shining's" iconic scenes, it has been well-received for its artistic representation and Savage's performance.
